name: Next-Gen Solar PV

image.attribution: Stanford ENERGY, Video by Mark Shwartz (CC BY 2.5)

description: III-V Semiconductors solar panels and perovskite-based panels

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: This new generation of photovoltaic cells have astounding efficiency improvements.

4ca04e21-062e-45a1-853a-745c793ecc6d.speaker: The Engineer
4ca04e21-062e-45a1-853a-745c793ecc6d.text: It makes all sorts of applications feasible now!

name: Luxury for All

image.attribution: Ijas muhammod, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons

description: Socialism is about providing not just bread and roses, but BVLGARI and Rolls Royces for all. Sure, the environmental costs will be high, but isn't socialism about humanizing the forces of nature to achieve our ends?

name: Carbon Capture and Sequestration
description: Mandate installation of point-source carbon capture and sequestration (CSS) on all fossil-fuel using facilities to store CO2 underground.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: We were able to reduce emissions somewhat, but leaks and upstream emissions limited the overall amount.

name: Space Colony
description: Establish off-world colonies.

0.speaker: The Spacer
0.text: The off-world colony was a success!

75c1072b-403a-4e2b-a69e-1b9405d38049.speaker: The Spacer
75c1072b-403a-4e2b-a69e-1b9405d38049.text: In the process our scout probes explored Europa and discovered life-like forms.

e0ef4c5e-0f49-4405-b318-9a9001cbc659.speaker: The Spacer
e0ef4c5e-0f49-4405-b318-9a9001cbc659.text: I'll send you the data for further analysis.

e2552370-8a61-4c02-ae8b-198471185164.speaker: Gossy
e2552370-8a61-4c02-ae8b-198471185164.text: In the process our robotic scout probes explored Europa

0.speaker: The Spacer
0.text: The off-world colony was a success!

name: Crack Down on Crypto-Mining
description: There is no official money in the post-revolutionary society, but libertarians still use crypto on the black market. Take thousands of these cryptographic-solving machines off the grid to save some electricity.

0.speaker: The Economist
0.text: We've got a lot of extra graphics cards now, not sure what to do with them.

6898c38e-6178-44ec-a9d4-364b4f3235e2.speaker: The Economist
6898c38e-6178-44ec-a9d4-364b4f3235e2.text: I guess we could recycle them?

name: Sewage Treatment Plants
description: Build a global network of sewage treatment plants. This will clean up rivers and lakes, produce organic fertilizer, restore habitats, and improve health of local inhabitants.

name: Esperanto
description: Unite humanity in a way it hasn't been since the Tower of Babel. Even better, achieve this goal with an artificial and cosmopolitan language rather than a colonial lingua franca. Once we achieve this goal then the utopia of global equality, peace and prosperity doesn't seem so impossible.

0.speaker: The Citizen
0.text: Lernu la anglan se vi volas gajni monon; lernu Esperanton se vi volas amikiĝi.

name: Expand National Parks

image.attribution: Portraits and habits of our birds via Biodiversity Heritage Library, CC BY 2.0

description: Place large amounts of habitable land under protection to preserve biodiversity.

0.speaker: The Utopian
0.text: This level of land protection is great...a good start.

54d91a66-72d6-4bc7-9b90-dec148f00d17.speaker: The Utopian
54d91a66-72d6-4bc7-9b90-dec148f00d17.text: Maybe we ought to consider stepping it up a bit?

c8888903-12fd-4174-aeda-14f6b33faa8c.speaker: The Utopian
c8888903-12fd-4174-aeda-14f6b33faa8c.text: But quite a lot of land is still left exposed.

e520d1e5-3822-41da-b845-288010412fd9.speaker: The Environmentalist
e520d1e5-3822-41da-b845-288010412fd9.text: I'm happy that there's more outdoors for me to hike in and enjoy :)

name: Green Hydrogen
description: Invest in the development of and infrastructure for zero-carbon hydrogen fuel generation.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: Research and development improved electrolysis efficiency and built infrastructure...

b4783e84-25c2-4832-87a6-80066e4933cc.speaker: The Engineer
b4783e84-25c2-4832-87a6-80066e4933cc.text: Hydrogen fuel can now be produced and transported on a mass scale without emissions.

name: Continental Smart Grid

image.attribution: Joe Corbett, Head of Technical Services with Mainstream Renewable Power, CC BY-SA 3.0

description: Smart grids can lower the net cost for renewable power by regulating fluctuations with demand response.

0.speaker: The Accelerationist
0.text: We've successfully integrated more renewable energy due to the smart grid's ability to respond to demand and reduce the chance of blackouts.

name: Cellular Meat
description: Cell-based meat or "craft meat" is in the news, but will it be as popular as meat?

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: We've figured out enough of the technical hurdles to start producing cellular meat on a larger scale.

3dc2c0c7-9b5f-4cb6-b985-3cf2501fceac.speaker: The Environmentalist
3dc2c0c7-9b5f-4cb6-b985-3cf2501fceac.text: Well, I'm glad I can keep eating meat without being guilted by others.

e2d34cfb-46fa-4e9e-893c-0feb424e77e2.speaker: The Consumerist
e2d34cfb-46fa-4e9e-893c-0feb424e77e2.text: It just doesn't hit the same way as real meat...

fb1f51c2-be21-44c5-86a6-8b7f55bc1ae5.speaker: The Consumerist
fb1f51c2-be21-44c5-86a6-8b7f55bc1ae5.text: I just hope the eco-freaks don't try to ban cows next.

name: Fanonist Curriculum

image.attribution: "Fidel Castro School Propaganda, Cuba" by ChrisGoldNY is marked with CC BY-NC 2.0

description: New curriculum includes a vast literacy campaign to empower the working class and peasants of the global South. The works of Frantz Fanon, Paulo Freire, Audre Lorde will find a broad audience. This program will improve living conditions in the global South as well as your relationship with the Fanonist.

name: Utopian Curriculum
description: Create a new curriculum that will teach students creative skills such as poetry and traditional weaving, skills that will make them successful 'social engineers' who will think about future utopian possibilities. They will read classics by Ursula Le Guin, William Morris, Thomas More, and Otto Neurath.

0.speaker: The Utopian
0.text: My recycling posters were inspired by Neurath's isotypes. Where would we be today without him!

name: Consumerist Curriculum

image.attribution: "Students Study" by garryknight is marked with CC BY 2.0.

description: Create a new curriculum that won't teach critical thinking, but rather greed and mindless individualism. Just get a good job and try to keep up with the Joneses. Books by Steven Pinker and Thomas Friedman are often assigned; 'American Psycho' is taught unironically. This curriculum your relationship to the Consumerist.

0.speaker: The Consumerist
0.text: It's really important to have a job that others will respect. Your day to day life is working to being able to treat yourself for all the stress endured. It's called self care.

name: Close Borders
description: Close borders between regions to slow down the movement of climate refugees. It will keep rich countries content but could spell doom for poor, hotter ones.

0.speaker: The Authoritarian
0.text: Closing the border is a tough decision, I know.

19087d6c-f7ce-4ff2-a7c8-48c83ed0a174.speaker: The Malthusian
19087d6c-f7ce-4ff2-a7c8-48c83ed0a174.text: ...and people are always the most troublesome variable.

64a6403e-959f-4ca9-90bb-b79ba72c9d56.speaker: The Malthusian
64a6403e-959f-4ca9-90bb-b79ba72c9d56.text: All these problems become easier to manage if you can simplify your variables...

9c4fcde3-aa13-4ca2-bc46-8511d391cfa9.speaker: The Authoritarian
9c4fcde3-aa13-4ca2-bc46-8511d391cfa9.text: But it's for the greater good. Otherwise things would spiral out of control.

name: Ecofeminist Curriculum

image.attribution: 'Curiosity' ca. 1660–62 by Gerard ter Borch the Younger, The MET, Public Domain

description: This new curriculum will teach students to think critically about the supposed objectivity of science or the naturalness of patriarchy. Students will read classics such as the 'Cyborg Manifesto', the 'Sexual Politics of Meat', the 'Parable of the Sower'. This policy will improve your relationship with the Ecofeminist.

name: Underwater Biosphere
description: Build a self-sustainable underwater habitat for long-term human, plant and animal habitation.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: We did it!

19f3665c-9ba5-4ea6-838a-fe4bf8ae9e6b.speaker: The Engineer
19f3665c-9ba5-4ea6-838a-fe4bf8ae9e6b.text: We've built the perfect self-sufficient biosphere with built-in systems to manage air, water, food and electricity.

4948a1e7-e2be-46f7-9b40-47d921a67813.speaker: The Engineer
4948a1e7-e2be-46f7-9b40-47d921a67813.text: I'm not sure anyone would want to *live* in these domes, but they provide a great environment for research.

63b7bfdc-d44f-49e2-b87e-d0077f3c276d.speaker: The Engineer
63b7bfdc-d44f-49e2-b87e-d0077f3c276d.text: While the center bio-dome monitors life-support operations, humans, plants and animals would live and interact in the surrounding domes.

name: Phage Therapy

image.attribution: "Phage" by TheSimple1 is marked with CC BY-NC-ND 2.0

description: Research the use of viruses ('phages') to kill bacteria. See this as a global insurance policy against the eventual obsolescence of antibiotics due to antimicrobial resistance (AMR). Phages might not be as effective as antibiotics, but they are better than nothing.

0.speaker: The Doctor
0.text: It was a major effort, but it will be worthwhile. AMR might kill ten million people a year.

e014487e-9378-4209-b30b-01cde9320315.speaker: The Doctor
e014487e-9378-4209-b30b-01cde9320315.text: It would be better if we addressed the causes of AMR by shrinking the industrial livestock industry and improving living standards in the Global South...

name: Suspend Parliament
description: Suspend parliament so that nothing gets in the way of your plans. This will give you some time and political capital carry out your agenda, but discontent will increase.

0.speaker: The Authoritarian
0.text: We have taken over the global parliament and sent the legislators home.

6eec594e-4533-4dbd-a8d9-442ae9c46976.speaker: The Authoritarian
6eec594e-4533-4dbd-a8d9-442ae9c46976.text: The revolution that overthrew capitalism was not so long ago.

c6e727d8-9767-4fb1-bd31-1db24f83ed9b.speaker: The Authoritarian
c6e727d8-9767-4fb1-bd31-1db24f83ed9b.text: You will be able to pass any laws you want by decree.

cb925796-4624-4209-8507-4872124466dd.speaker: The Authoritarian
cb925796-4624-4209-8507-4872124466dd.text: Yet, the people are seething underneath your boot.

name: Soil Fertility AI
description: A sensing layer for all the world's farms. pH level, temperature, Moisture content and NPK (nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium) to help to evaluate and manage soil fertility.

0.speaker: The Farmer
0.text: We've seen a modest boost in crop yields from this new infrastructure.

10719ea6-c5f9-40c6-8fd5-19f52e65c8de.speaker: The Farmer
10719ea6-c5f9-40c6-8fd5-19f52e65c8de.text: Strangely, we keep getting emails from the spinach saying they want 10x as much nitrogen than necessary.

name: Mine Moon for Tritium
description: Tritium is a rare fuel used in fusion reactors, but it is plentiful on the moon.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: Well the mining initiative was a success!

3c261125-331e-4915-a289-8b6b5792deea.speaker: The Engineer
3c261125-331e-4915-a289-8b6b5792deea.text: We've tapped into enough tritium to cover our fusion needs for, well, forever as far as I can tell.

name: Reconcile Town and Country
description: Achieve a goal set out in the Communist Manifesto: the 'gradual abolition of all the distinction between town and country by a more equable distribution of the populace over the country.' Bring culture into the countryside to combat the 'idiocy' of rural life. Bring farms and gardens into the city, so people can describe their green thumbs.

0.speaker: The Economist
0.text: Quite a lot of people have made the move to the countrysides of the world.

9c72ec21-cf80-4b52-a104-2f8f2cd91f35.speaker: The Economist
9c72ec21-cf80-4b52-a104-2f8f2cd91f35.text: And most have reported it as an improvement in their quality of life.

bdfc30db-990b-4783-8b30-32530f4fe584.speaker: The Citizen
bdfc30db-990b-4783-8b30-32530f4fe584.text: It's a lot quieter, and the fresh air has done wonders for me.

name: Mass Electrification
description: Mass electrify services and devices that typically do not use electricity.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: You hear that?

b62e6b61-7e96-4e3d-90c8-a8afc8061155.speaker: The Engineer
b62e6b61-7e96-4e3d-90c8-a8afc8061155.text: No more roaring and rattling of engines, the sputtering and belching of combustion...

name: Gadgets, Fast Fashion, and Endless TV

image.attribution: Wags05 at English Wikipedia, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

description: Improve morale the easy way.

0.speaker: The Citizen
0.text: I love watching old shows that I've already seen a dozen times, something about it makes me feel comforted by the nostalgia.

name: Drought-Resistant Crops
description: Develop new more drought-resistant varieties and encourage the adoption of existing drought-resistant crops.

0.speaker: The Farmer
0.text: Droughts aren't nearly as devastating as they once were thanks to these new varieties.

79d1bcb3-b0d5-4105-b7de-68ad28ea4705.speaker: The Farmer
79d1bcb3-b0d5-4105-b7de-68ad28ea4705.text: Glad I can rest a bit easier now.

96071725-12ba-4448-a327-f773ef6718ae.speaker: The Farmer
96071725-12ba-4448-a327-f773ef6718ae.text: They're especially welcome in regions normally at high risk for water shortages.

name: Half-Earth
description: Protect half of all habitable land as national parks. This project will half the Sixth Extinction in its tracks and turn our post-capitalist society into Half-Earth Socialism. Rewild parks by reintroducing predators and other missing species to further increase biodiversity.

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: Wildlife populations are thriving and have increased soil carbon sequestration.

639c8a45-83aa-4c95-b92f-00c67e222969.speaker: The Utopian
639c8a45-83aa-4c95-b92f-00c67e222969.text: To have achieved our vision of Half Earth...I'm speechless.

902a5fcc-02ad-4e8b-a9b7-22424638d42f.speaker: The Utopian
902a5fcc-02ad-4e8b-a9b7-22424638d42f.text: There's still so much more to do, but I'll forever remember this moment.

name: Direct Air Capture
description: Install DAC units to take CO2 out of the atmosphere.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: The first DAC installations are up and running, and sucking carbon out of the air.

10bc9589-af42-40f6-8f89-7cb7ad2c1559.speaker: The Engineer
10bc9589-af42-40f6-8f89-7cb7ad2c1559.text: It's not a huge amount though, and it needs a lot of energy.

899af48e-5986-4c47-b3f8-862a8f075ff7.speaker: Gossy
899af48e-5986-4c47-b3f8-862a8f075ff7.text: You can expand the DAC capacity in the planning tool, if you want.

name: Food Waste Campaign
description: Begin a campaign to address food waste across all parts of the food system.

0.speaker: The Economist
0.text: The Food Waste Campaign has been very successful!

f265446e-da36-4915-aaab-7c31b3e01c71.speaker: The Engineer
f265446e-da36-4915-aaab-7c31b3e01c71.text: We have a reliable stream of extra organic material too.

ff5c5c2d-6737-4840-8852-24c2f560d6c6.speaker: The Engineer
ff5c5c2d-6737-4840-8852-24c2f560d6c6.text: We could process this into biomaterials, such as crichton from crab shells, and streamline the process for large scale production.

name: Animal Liberationist Curriculum

image.attribution: David Teniers the Younger, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

description: Give students an anti-speciesist education where they question human supremacy. After all, what makes us so different from animals? Students will read classics such as 'Beasts of Burden', 'Animal Liberation', and 'Zoopolis'. This educational program will improve your relations with the Animal Liberationist.

0.speaker: The Animal Liberationist
0.text: The new curriculum instills children with a sense of compassion for all human and non-human animals.

name: Carbon-Negative Concrete

image.attribution: 'Concrete wall' by bburky Reuse, CC BY 2.0

description: Scale up carbon-negative concrete production processes.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: We've seen modest CO2 emission reductions by adapting lower impact production processes.

name: Artificial Moons
description: Illuminate cities using satellites that will reflect sunlight onto nighttime cities below. This project will marginally lower electrical demand and will likely adversely affect nocturnal animals.

0.speaker: The Geoengineer
0.text: We have turned night into day! We can control the Earth like an artifact.

name: High-Density Batteries
description: Develop higher-density alternatives to existing batteries, expanding where they can be used.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: Batteries are a tricky thing. They've heavy and material intensive.

0bc90dcc-c854-4d50-b2fa-c58d5638ffc7.speaker: The Engineer
0bc90dcc-c854-4d50-b2fa-c58d5638ffc7.text: That means we can use batteries in a lot of places that we couldn't before.

93aafc5d-58f5-40f7-9f3f-c918dd9707c2.speaker: The Engineer
93aafc5d-58f5-40f7-9f3f-c918dd9707c2.text: But we've figured out a few ways to make them more economical, and lighter too.

name: Expand Recycling
description: Expand recycling infrastructure to rural and undeveloped areas and implement research and development initiatives in electronics recycling and plasma gasification.

0.speaker: The Economist
0.text: The new global recycling program has helped keep plastic out of the ocean, as well as other ecosystems.

48cc924d-8e91-43c8-8d36-9406bda2a1b2.speaker: The Utopian
48cc924d-8e91-43c8-8d36-9406bda2a1b2.text: It also made the world a bit nicer to live in for humans.

f8081bfa-4709-4e58-b923-484e0a89b865.speaker: The Citizen
f8081bfa-4709-4e58-b923-484e0a89b865.text: The elderly folks in my town love hanging out around the drop off facilities making sure people put the correct recyclables in the right bin.

name: Abolish Zoos

image.attribution: frank wouters from antwerpen, belgium, CC BY 2.0

description: Animals in zoos suffer high mortality, depression, stress, and injuries from patrons. Zoos have a illness named after them, 'zoochosis', were animals engage in repetitive pacing or swaying. This policy where release animals when possible back into the wild and others into sanctuaries.

0.speaker: The Animal Liberationist
0.text: We don't put people in cages anymore, so why do we still think it's ok for animals?

6ae6a2a5-079e-4c89-8d70-80060f1ab245.speaker: The Animal Liberationist
6ae6a2a5-079e-4c89-8d70-80060f1ab245.text: I say good riddance to those horrendous institutions of suffering.

name: Eliminate Natural Predation

image.attribution: "Peace" by Muffet is licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 2.0

description: Some say the end point of animal liberation is the ending of all suffering, both amongst farm animals and wild ones. This research project will require planned habitats, cross-species immunocontraception, swimming nanorobots, gene editing, and super computers to manage a global ecosystem free from pain.

0.speaker: The Animal Liberationist
0.text: It was quite the undertaking, and an incredibly complex project, but it was worth it in the end.

ba8db407-af9c-4e68-b933-b5e346e76024.speaker: The Animal Liberationist
ba8db407-af9c-4e68-b933-b5e346e76024.text: I can sleep soundly tonight knowing that no animal is at risk of being hunted, whether by humans or by other animals.

name: Feminist Science and Technology Studies

image.attribution: Photographer Daniel SoneNational Cancer Institute, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

description: Reform the scientific establishment by integrating the insights of forty years of feminist science and technology studies. Help scientists become more self-aware of their own biases and the limits of scientific 'objectivity'. Expand the ranks of scientists by recruiting more women to the highest ranks of their disciplines. All of this will amount to a new scientific revolution.

0.speaker: The Ecofeminist
0.text: We've been able to collect much more dynamic data about how the Earth is changing after establishing studies that survey people's experiences.

name: Expand Public Transit
description: A global effort to develop new comprehensive public transit networks and upgrade ailing existing networks.

0.speaker: The Environmentalist
0.text: The city air feels fresher somehow, you know?

08e9cdc7-61fd-459b-b214-4475dd885562.speaker: The Environmentalist
08e9cdc7-61fd-459b-b214-4475dd885562.text: ...and these new systems are clogging up the roads and make driving a pain.

1c540234-3790-4062-b561-c74e10ac2f33.speaker: The Environmentalist
1c540234-3790-4062-b561-c74e10ac2f33.text: (even though I don't use it myself)

21fc46d4-f892-48be-9c5e-4a97387843c9.speaker: The Environmentalist
21fc46d4-f892-48be-9c5e-4a97387843c9.text: Well I'm all for public transit...

560ccd76-5d83-4bd7-b2df-f2facdcd6d6c.speaker: The Environmentalist
560ccd76-5d83-4bd7-b2df-f2facdcd6d6c.text: Communities affected most by highway infrastructure are experiencing less air pollution and increased health.

69902c01-89e7-4c80-85dc-bdb30ca641f5.speaker: The Environmentalist
69902c01-89e7-4c80-85dc-bdb30ca641f5.text: I guess less people are driving now that public transit is so convenient.

name: Factory Farming Reform
description: Slaughterhouses are still brutal, but for now the kill lines will be slower and some of the worst practices have been banned, such as de-beaking, tail docking, and horn bud burning, as well as feeding animals feces, carcasses, candy, and garbage.

0.speaker: The Environmentalist
0.text: I feel way less guilty about eating meat now!

344d9532-58af-42d3-9550-f3779735d66f.speaker: The Animal Liberationist
344d9532-58af-42d3-9550-f3779735d66f.text: This is a bunch of incrementalist garbage!

69645ca6-c8d0-4176-944e-d33b2e65c35a.speaker: The Animal Liberationist
69645ca6-c8d0-4176-944e-d33b2e65c35a.text: A bigger cage is still a cage, and a death sentence still a death sentence!

71dcf55b-90f8-487e-90c4-6393b81cd2fe.speaker: The Consumerist
71dcf55b-90f8-487e-90c4-6393b81cd2fe.text: But it's gotten harder to find meat, which I'm not happy about.

name: Agricultural Robotics
description: Increasing production yields for farmers using robots to reduce human labor for tasks like spraying and weeding, crop harvesting, seeding and planting, soil analysis, and livestock feeding.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: These robots are...ok.

1d16c81f-0202-459e-878a-729838ae678a.speaker: The Farmer
1d16c81f-0202-459e-878a-729838ae678a.text: But they've freed up some time, so I'm happy about that.

398c68c8-4f07-434a-bb4c-b061bb7f3772.speaker: The Engineer
398c68c8-4f07-434a-bb4c-b061bb7f3772.text: They still can't handle a lot of environmental conditions encountered on a farm, but they've found some consistent uses.

834e0842-340f-4a97-adcc-9b62a446f931.speaker: Gossy
834e0842-340f-4a97-adcc-9b62a446f931.text: Nothing compared to my AI, but I don't have to manipulate delicate plants or tread through muddy soil!

f2e364bf-16ee-46ef-b765-8d1383696fad.speaker: The Ecologist
f2e364bf-16ee-46ef-b765-8d1383696fad.text: And they kill *a lot* of bugs and other critters...

name: Nuclear Fusion
description: Conduct research into nuclear fusion. Odds of success are low and fusion still has many of the drawback of fission (radioactive waste, water-use for coolant, reliant on rare resources). Still, a possible source of low-carbon plentiful energy.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: Success!

54b2f89b-14d0-4343-bd5f-d1f68214a1bc.speaker: The Engineer
54b2f89b-14d0-4343-bd5f-d1f68214a1bc.text: It was always 20 years in the future, and it seems like it actually was.

878b361b-3237-4f72-9994-e6c9ec52705c.speaker: The Engineer
878b361b-3237-4f72-9994-e6c9ec52705c.text: It's not *free* energy, but it's a lot better than what we had before.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: Our research has failed.

e4f9da85-62d9-4239-9cd9-663da18c5321.speaker: The Engineer
e4f9da85-62d9-4239-9cd9-663da18c5321.text: Fusion power might never become a reality...

name: Ocean Iron Fertilization
description: Dump iron into the oceans to stimulate diatom growth, which might sequester four gigatonnes of CO2 a year. This technique might not work and could have detrimental ecological effects.

0.speaker: The Climatologist
0.text: The experiment succeeded in drawing down carbon from the atmosphere, but it had an uninteded side-effect...

6c0852f2-5432-4ad2-876b-aa73a6a2d931.speaker: The Climatologist
6c0852f2-5432-4ad2-876b-aa73a6a2d931.text: The rotting algae formed anoxic dead zones on the abyssal plains, killing much ocean life...

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: The abundance of diatoms not only sequestered carbon, but fed millions of salmon fry and other marine life. This was a great success!

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: For a short time, the surface waters bloomed, but there was no mechanism to transport it to the deep...

87685025-f1a7-4253-a36e-be4977e3f44d.speaker: The Engineer
87685025-f1a7-4253-a36e-be4977e3f44d.text: There are no ecological consequences, which is good, but the project also didn't sequester any carbon.

name: Mass Demilitarization
description: Begin global program to destroy weapons and scale down military and police budgets around the world.

0.speaker: The Economist
0.text: Demilitarization resulted in a significant drop in global emissions, as well as an increase in global outlook and untold tons of salvageable metals.

ace73166-ee6a-40d2-b2ee-537d1afab137.speaker: The Authoritarian
ace73166-ee6a-40d2-b2ee-537d1afab137.text: I hope this doesn't come back to bite us...

name: Psyop

image.attribution: Staff Sgt. Samuel Bendet, U.S. Air Force, Public domain

description: Carry out 'psychological operations' to increase your political support and discredit your opponents. This can take the form of propaganda, influencing the media, staging events to create the appearance of popular support.

0.speaker: The Authoritarian
0.text: I'm glad you agreed to trust me. I'll make things easier for you, but don't ask me how I do it.

name: Champagne Socialism

image.attribution: 'Follow day-22-alcohol-poster' by Leo Smith Photos, CC BY 2.0

description: Make champagne an everyday luxury. After all, socialism is about roses as well as bread.

0.speaker: The Citizen
0.text: I know the guy who makes these beautiful wines, no sulfates, all natural.

b6622325-9853-4df6-af09-2b7e30c8543e.speaker: The Citizen
b6622325-9853-4df6-af09-2b7e30c8543e.text: We should go up to see his vineyard sometime.

name: Remove Fetters on the Forces of Production!
description: Rapidly increase development throughout the world to catch up to Global North levels.

0.speaker: The Fanonist
0.text: It's nice to have resources directed towards our countries for once.

25dbe961-0da8-452a-89cf-0b6799c390d3.speaker: The Fanonist
25dbe961-0da8-452a-89cf-0b6799c390d3.text: Maybe not...but this is a gesture of good faith, at least.

3284439b-5687-4599-b3bd-24f80d527427.speaker: The Fanonist
3284439b-5687-4599-b3bd-24f80d527427.text: Will it ever match the wealth that was stolen from us?

c96aadd9-d4bf-4ff6-aa06-822873c74242.speaker: The Environmentalist
c96aadd9-d4bf-4ff6-aa06-822873c74242.text: I don't think the planet can sustain it!

e549f5f9-f1f6-405b-88fd-7d4278b36559.speaker: The Malthusian
e549f5f9-f1f6-405b-88fd-7d4278b36559.text: You do realize that not everyone can enjoy a high standard of living?

name: Degrowth in  Developed Regions
description: Reduce the development level of wealthy regions. Consumption impacts will be lowered, though quality of life may not decrease by much.

0.speaker: The Consumerist
0.text: What are you doing?

707a0e11-da13-49ad-8cba-82098b36f998.speaker: The Accelerationist
707a0e11-da13-49ad-8cba-82098b36f998.text: ...with the right technology and conditions, no one has to give anything up...

c0fb56ee-c2d3-4a0c-9ba8-65d9833f452c.speaker: The Consumerist
c0fb56ee-c2d3-4a0c-9ba8-65d9833f452c.text: You're supposed to make things better, not worse!

f4a22c40-b6b8-49c9-8c60-68bbd94d5c66.speaker: The Fanonist
f4a22c40-b6b8-49c9-8c60-68bbd94d5c66.text: It's about time that we recognize who the main perpetrators of all these crises are.

name: Multistrata Agroforestry
description: A perennial cropping system featuring multiple layers of trees and other perennial crops, with high biosequestration impacts and food production.

0.speaker: The Ecofeminist
0.text: With the restoration of the Satoyama forests, students and senior citizens work with farmers to plant rice and clear irrigation channels.

94581543-0510-403f-8a88-b5e51ba7a327.speaker: The Ecofeminist
94581543-0510-403f-8a88-b5e51ba7a327.text: We call ourselves the Matsutake Crusaders. Our co-op has been working together to condition the forest for Matsutake mushrooms to thrive again.

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: So many more wonderful trees make habitats and store carbon, while still supporting food production.

3b541e4c-e088-4da7-ad24-9bf83b773229.speaker: The Farmer
3b541e4c-e088-4da7-ad24-9bf83b773229.text: I quite like working under the canopy...the shade's nice.

name: Restrictions on Air Travel
description: Limit air travel to only long-haul trips that can't be accomplished by train.

0.speaker: The Consumerist
0.text: I thought I would hate the inconvenience of not being able to fly...

name: Militarized Conservation

image.attribution: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service Headquarters, Public domain

description: Protect nature preserves with a small army of heavily armed park rangers. Their shoot-to-kill policy against poachers has made conservatism unpopular, especially in poor countries.

0.speaker: The Environmentalist
0.text: It may appear extreme to some, but sometimes you have to be a little tough with people to keep nature safe.

06c68620-4a93-421b-a303-03f8ea27e9df.speaker: The Environmentalist
06c68620-4a93-421b-a303-03f8ea27e9df.text: Some people just don't know any better, you know what I mean?

name: Co-Generation
description: Install co-generation systems in eligible structures and power facilities to generate electricity and heat at the same time, making use of otherwise wasted heat.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: If we've still got to combust things for energy, this is at least an improvement.

name: Energy Quotas
description: Limit per-capita energy consumption to a level supportive of a good quality of life, though perhaps far lower than wealthier regions are used to.

0.speaker: The Consumerist
0.text: These restrictions have been ridiculous!

2fee41e0-ff5c-4457-866a-f6e27bb1b1f1.speaker: The Consumerist
2fee41e0-ff5c-4457-866a-f6e27bb1b1f1.text: How can anyone survive on such a pathetic amount of energy?

fd27a444-fdef-45d9-ae92-5737348970ad.speaker: The Fanonist
fd27a444-fdef-45d9-ae92-5737348970ad.text: I've lived decently on less energy than this...I'm sure you'll get used to it.

name: Stakhanovite Shock Workers
description: People will work longer and harder, but socialism will be built faster.

0.speaker: The Economist
0.text: Wow, we've produced more than fourteen times the usual quota this year alone.

e69d87de-649b-442c-b06c-a5baa090165d.speaker: The Citizen
e69d87de-649b-442c-b06c-a5baa090165d.text: My back hurts from these long work hours. I hope it's worth it...

name: De-extinction Initiative
description: A controversial technology among ecologists. While attempts to bring back mammoths are likely more crowd pleasers than real science, recently extinct animals might be usefully restored.

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: We were able to bring back the passenger pigeon, but this quickly became an exotic poultry dish leading to its extinction again.

b466ec58-459b-4a7e-a072-8300df5ac1c1.speaker: The Ecologist
b466ec58-459b-4a7e-a072-8300df5ac1c1.text: And now I'm getting a lot of requests to use this technology for designer dogs.

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: We succeeded in cloning some lost species and successfully re-introduced them into their original ecosystems.

6a01d6a5-6f79-46c4-8936-079a5ec40d30.speaker: The Ecologist
6a01d6a5-6f79-46c4-8936-079a5ec40d30.text: Surprisingly there haven't been any major issues.

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: We succeeded in cloning some lost species, but they all were either short-lived or could not survive in the wild.

name: Cloud Brightening
description: Inject particles into clouds to reflect more sunlight, reducing global temperatures.

0.speaker: The Climatologist
0.text: The presence of aerosol particles promotes cloud thinning, reducing the amount of water in the cloud, letting more solar radiation pass through.

name: Biofabrication
description: Production of products from raw materials such as living cells and biomaterials. Able to produce materials traditionally composed of animal based products or petroleum based products.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: We've shifted quite a lot of petroleum-based plastic to these new biofabrication methods.

66a1e0be-18f6-49b5-ad66-e7908455ce6a.speaker: The Engineer
66a1e0be-18f6-49b5-ad66-e7908455ce6a.text: Still, we're at least introducing less new CO2 into the atmosphere by avoiding some fossil fuel usage.

d90cc81d-5c84-4f45-8ac5-789144edaf2e.speaker: The Engineer
d90cc81d-5c84-4f45-8ac5-789144edaf2e.text: But--even though we use far less plastic than we did pre-revolution--the amount of biomass available still isn't enough to fully replace petroleum-based plastics.

name: Ban High-Seas Fishing

image.attribution: The original uploader was Jom at German Wikipedia., CC BY-SA 2.0 DE, via Wikimedia Commons

description: Ban fishing outside of exclusive economic zones (200 miles from the coast).

0.speaker: The Economist
0.text: The high seas fishing ban has had benefits...

03688871-7651-463b-9cb7-072d27707f67.speaker: The Economist
03688871-7651-463b-9cb7-072d27707f67.text: but they have been limited since it has been difficult to enforce and less than 10% of global fish catch was on the high seas.

3ef4d462-993e-4ffb-8eb1-e1668319953a.speaker: The Animal Liberationist
3ef4d462-993e-4ffb-8eb1-e1668319953a.text: Maybe we ought to consider a blanket ban on commercial fishing?

name: Asteroid Mining
description: Build out infrastructure to mine, process, and transport minerals from asteroids.

0.speaker: The Spacer
0.text: We were able to capture the Davida asteroid and steer it within Earth's orbit and unleash a tremendous amount of lithium and rare earth metals.

a123f536-aa69-49b8-8411-93716801ae1c.speaker: The Accelerationist
a123f536-aa69-49b8-8411-93716801ae1c.text: ...no doubt many evironmentally-destructive mining practices will become obsolete...

name: Phase Out Commercial Fishing

image.attribution: The original uploader was Jom at German Wikipedia., CC BY-SA 2.0 DE, via Wikimedia Commons

description: End subsidies for commercial seafood extraction and implement transition programs for workers in the fishing sector.

0.speaker: The Consumerist
0.text: I want my fresh local swordfish, tuna, lobster and crabmeat!

c208209f-da17-4ab3-9742-bbbe396e6ddc.speaker: The Consumerist
c208209f-da17-4ab3-9742-bbbe396e6ddc.text: Now I can't get any of it...

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: The hairy-nosed otter (Lutra sumatrana) has been seen again!

e0549834-1715-4afd-816c-59622a6a872d.speaker: The Ecologist
e0549834-1715-4afd-816c-59622a6a872d.text: Now a popular manga mascot, this rare otter represents hope and honor.

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: The health of ancient corals is improving, providing protection from destructive storm surges waves.

name: Predator Reintroduction Program
description: A global program to reintroduce predators large and small to a variety of ecosystems. This will increase biodiversity and create resilient ecosystems that can sequester more carbon.

0.speaker: The Farmer
0.text: More wolves, lions, cougars, and other large predators means more livestock have been attacked!

name: Electric-Arc Furnaces
description: Improved efficiency compared to a blast furnace. Allows steel to be made from 100% scrap material rather than virgin steelmaking from ores, which is less energy intensive.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: We've improved efficiency of this process and converted existing steel manufacturing facilities to use it.

name: Open-Ocean Fish Farms

image.attribution: NOAA's National Ocean Service, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

description: Scale up open ocean fish aquaculture to sustain seafood production.

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: Fish aquaculture may have sustained seafood production, but it only shifted fishing pressure from large fish to smaller ones.

4a090ea1-fc52-4e96-8e78-eacace4e2893.speaker: The Ecologist
4a090ea1-fc52-4e96-8e78-eacace4e2893.text: It also incubated new fish pathogens and resulted in outbreaks of invasive species.

name: Battery Storage Network
description: Build battery storage capacity and transmission to resolve intermittency and supply issues. Especially useful for a renewable energy dependent grid.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: This new battery network will help a lot with large-scale electrification and improving reliability.

name: Coastal Wetland Protection and Restoration
description: Coastal wetlands across the globe are given protected status, and historic wetlands are restored.

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: I think it's a great shame that eels and frogs don't get the same attention as Polar bears and penguins.

5f462f87-8aba-41d7-9303-63193cf6a3bf.speaker: The Ecologist
5f462f87-8aba-41d7-9303-63193cf6a3bf.text: Around 40 percent of all plant and animal species rely on these wetlands.

fb52a244-eb6a-4e9d-812a-a8a7df839798.speaker: The Ecologist
fb52a244-eb6a-4e9d-812a-a8a7df839798.text: Our slimy friends should be much happier now- along with geese, deer, and all the life in and around these wetlands.

name: Space Elevator
description: Reduces need for fuel-intensive transport for the space industry.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: We've successfully built a space elevator, putting the stars one step closer.

005d0bb4-68ab-403f-9fd1-330ca6415dbf.speaker: The Engineer
005d0bb4-68ab-403f-9fd1-330ca6415dbf.text: We're in a better position to expand space activities, if you so choose.

3a44847f-069c-44e9-8df4-0d96110c09c1.speaker: The Spacer
3a44847f-069c-44e9-8df4-0d96110c09c1.text: I'm so excited to try it out!

name: Meatless Mondays

image.attribution: Suzette - www.suzette.nu from Arnhem, Netherlands, CC BY 2.0

description: One day a week people will abstain from eating meat, which will reduce demand accordingly. This will reduce pressure on ecosystems and greenhouse gas emissions.

0.speaker: The Citizen
0.text: I found it surprisingly easy to cut meat out of my diet once a week.

2db586ba-f83d-421b-ae86-a5071871e19a.speaker: The Citizen
2db586ba-f83d-421b-ae86-a5071871e19a.text: There are certain meals that feature meat that are important in my culture, and I would hate to lose them.

7adf5db8-8e41-45bc-b2d9-ae735d9ec28c.speaker: The Consumerist
7adf5db8-8e41-45bc-b2d9-ae735d9ec28c.text: This feels like a slippery slope...

b3372ce6-ebb2-4d79-a04d-becac2a5ffe4.speaker: The Citizen
b3372ce6-ebb2-4d79-a04d-becac2a5ffe4.text: But cutting it out every once in awhile feels reasonable to me.

name: Vegan Mandate

image.attribution: FranHogan, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons

description: Implement a ban on all animal products, effective immediately.

0.speaker: The Consumerist
0.text: These last few years have been miserable.

701c5f74-1e18-4ff4-8d03-d4b1b6f45f75.speaker: The Consumerist
701c5f74-1e18-4ff4-8d03-d4b1b6f45f75.text: Sure, I get eating less meat, but banning it entirely?

86c9fc4e-b4af-4076-bffb-460a25cfc407.speaker: The Consumerist
86c9fc4e-b4af-4076-bffb-460a25cfc407.text: You're mad with power--how was this a good idea?

d2e93aff-6b98-4211-b2ab-0d21ceb15956.speaker: The Environmentalist
d2e93aff-6b98-4211-b2ab-0d21ceb15956.text: Can't we just figure out more sustainable and ethical ways to produce meat?

name: Green Roofs
description: Soil and vegetation function as living roof insulation, moderating building temperatures year-round. Greenhouse gas emissions are lower.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: Did you know that green roofs can reflect up to 80% of the solar energy hitting it, back into space??

2b286a9f-471b-4f2e-865f-bfd2d6fa2668.speaker: The Engineer
2b286a9f-471b-4f2e-865f-bfd2d6fa2668.text: And it's nice to have an additional green space to enjoy.

473aa939-b88d-4561-8faf-711567a94e4d.speaker: The Engineer
473aa939-b88d-4561-8faf-711567a94e4d.text: I've noticed that my apartment's temperature is much more consistent now...

9365b7e2-935c-4029-b2e1-88609a2e3eb2.speaker: The Engineer
9365b7e2-935c-4029-b2e1-88609a2e3eb2.text: My kids stopped complaining as much, at least.

name: Biochar

image.attribution: GIZ/Tim Brunauer, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons

description: Mandate the use of biochar (basically a baked biomass) in all agriculture to improve soil health and sequester more carbon.

0.speaker: The Farmer
0.text: Biochar is doing wonders for my fields.

81f7608d-6c7c-49ff-92a6-1bccc31851da.speaker: The Farmer
81f7608d-6c7c-49ff-92a6-1bccc31851da.text: Good to know that the soil can hold carbon for centuries!

a534a431-6241-4747-971d-31a14193ef06.speaker: The Ecologist
a534a431-6241-4747-971d-31a14193ef06.text: Biochar seems to be successfully accelerating soil carbon sequestration, but we are unsure of the effects of removing so much decomposing vegetation from ecisystems.

d9246e25-30c5-457b-b395-64ea8e61b0bb.speaker: The Farmer
d9246e25-30c5-457b-b395-64ea8e61b0bb.text: The soil is richer than what I had before.

name: Ban Outdoor Cats

image.attribution: 'Mainzer's cats - tennis club' by Emma Paperclip, via Openverse under a CC BY 2.0 license

description: Cats kill 1.3-4 billion birds in US alone. It is estimated that cats have contributed to 14% of bird, mammal, and reptile extinctions.

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: The ban on outdoor cats is going well.

cb28504d-44a2-4b4e-9b76-bae12bc1097a.speaker: The Ecologist
cb28504d-44a2-4b4e-9b76-bae12bc1097a.text: Wild to think how much damage those critters can do!

name: Stop Food Aid

image.attribution: English:  Foreign and Commonwealth Office, OGL v1.0

description: This policy will reduce population by halting food aid to famished regions. Mortality will go up significantly.

0.speaker: The Malthusian
0.text: I agree, the battle to feed all of humanity is over.

name: Abolish Prisons

image.attribution: "Ruth Wilson Gilmore talking prison abolition at UC Merced #raceandjusticemerced" by tanyaboza is marked with CC BY 2.0.

description: Instead of prison, institute programs that will target the causes of crime by addressing poverty and mental health issues. Decriminalize sex work, drugs, and other offences that lead to felonies. Restorative justice and graduated re-integration will rehabilitate criminals and reconcile communities.

0.speaker: The Citizen
0.text: It's wrong to lock people up in cages. As a socialist society we can do better than this!

454ecb19-e337-4cae-bec5-3b9c7b4c36a7.speaker: The Authoritarian
454ecb19-e337-4cae-bec5-3b9c7b4c36a7.text: If you do this, don't expect help when you need some brute force to back you up...

name: Wooden Skyscrapers
description: Implement an initiative to store carbon captured by trees in human structures.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: Significant amounts of carbon were locked into human structures and wide-scale reforestation helped to buffer the ecological strain of increased logging.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: Significant amounts of carbon was locked into human structures, but the increase in logging put a serious strain on forest ecosystems.

name: 3rd Generation Biofuels
description: Develop improved and scalable algae biofuel production processes.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: A genetically altered strain of Nannochloropsis is able to produce a higher concentration of lipids for biofuel and butanol.

95d2e3ca-4d61-4cb4-bce1-6c07aadcc3c7.speaker: The Engineer
95d2e3ca-4d61-4cb4-bce1-6c07aadcc3c7.text: We can now grow and deploy algae-based biofuels at scale.

name: Rien Faire Comme une Bête

image.attribution: 'Boy with Cow at the River's Edge' by Hashimoto Gahō, The MET, Public Domain

description: People won't work as long and enjoy more leisure time. Energy-use will go down substantially, but projects will also take longer to finish.

0.speaker: The Citizen
0.text: Let's go hang out by the water.

f02d5692-98ea-4ab9-812b-e17bff435402.speaker: The Citizen
f02d5692-98ea-4ab9-812b-e17bff435402.text: Great!, let's go hang out by the water.

name: Solar Radiation Management
description: Launch aerosols into the air to blot out the sun.

0.speaker: The Climatologist
0.text: There as been an increase in acid rain. Delicately synchronized ecologies have been disturbed too.

0.speaker: The Climatologist
0.text: Some areas have experienced cooling, but without significant emissions abatement, SRM needs to be ramped up to keep pace.

name: Deep Sea Mining

image.attribution: NOAA Office of Ocean Exploration and Research (Public Domain)

description: Permit deep sea mining to open up vast new mineral resources, but at high risk to marine ecosystems.

0.speaker: The Economist
0.text: A number of deep sea mining operations have sprouted up, opening up a steady supply of many important metals and minerals.

c88f91d0-0a68-4972-9426-7721612c6d35.speaker: The Ecologist
c88f91d0-0a68-4972-9426-7721612c6d35.text: It has however disrupted the lives of those living down there, and plumes of effluent have clouded large parts of the oceans.

name: Ban Cars
description: Ban private vehicles first in urban areas then everywhere. Tear up highways and transform cites, while saving lives, fuel and steel. This is a hard policy to push through, but the gains are immense.

0.speaker: The Doctor
0.text: There has been a rapid decline in mortality from diabetes and coronary heart disease...

737cdc9a-34e1-4abd-8a61-4d941960c435.speaker: The Doctor
737cdc9a-34e1-4abd-8a61-4d941960c435.text: ...let alone fatalities from car accidents, which were on the order of millions of deaths per year.

name: Passive Building Retrofit and Mandate

image.attribution: Tetiana Ernst, CC BY-SA 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons

description: Implement guidelines for all new construction to use little energy thanks to improvements in insulation, clever design, and energy-production, and retrofit existing buildings to follow suit.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: It was a fair bit of work, but everyone appreciates upgrading old housing stock.

4fc9537e-5a51-4c2c-aca6-a8ec889725d5.speaker: The Engineer
4fc9537e-5a51-4c2c-aca6-a8ec889725d5.text: I myself love the calm silence of a passive house. HVAC can be so noisy, eh?

name: Indigenous Sovereignty over Traditional Territories
description: Transfer ancestral lands back to their historical stewards. Indigenous-managed territories often has greater biodiversity than comparable ecosystems.

0.speaker: The Economist
0.text: Reduced deforestation has helped avoid a great deal of carbon emissions...

4cd54b3e-dd4e-476d-a5f4-b4134dd30cbb.speaker: The Fanonist
4cd54b3e-dd4e-476d-a5f4-b4134dd30cbb.text: ...not to mention that this recognition of sovereignty is long overdue.

name: The Ark
description: Biodiversity has been plummeting, and people fear that most of earth's species will be lost forever. This project is an effort to collect and store DNA samples of earth's remaining biodiversity in case the worst should come to pass.

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: We had collected most of our samples but then a massive blackout spoiled everything...

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: We were able to successfully develop the Ark and collect samples of a majority of the remaining species.

name: Breeder Reactor
description: Research and develop nuclear reactors that run on spent uranium and generates more fissile material than it consumes

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: We can now deploy fast-breeder reactors, which will help alleviate uranium shortages by burning spent nuclear waste.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: We were never able to overcome the reprocessing and fuel fabrication balance challenges. It's time to throw in the towel.

name: One-Child Policy
description: No family can have more than one child.

0.speaker: The Economist
0.text: There are too many people living into seniority and not enough facilities to take care of them!

0.speaker: The Economist
0.text: The gender ratio has shifted as people prefer to have girls rather than boys.

name: Mission to Titan
description: Titan has an abundance of liquid hydrocarbons, more than even Earth. We could go get it...but why?

0.speaker: The Spacer
0.text: The mission was a success!

3946be3d-2d8e-418d-bbff-a617a45cbf22.speaker: The Spacer
3946be3d-2d8e-418d-bbff-a617a45cbf22.text: I mean, I'm ambivalent on the whole fossil fuels thing, but I'm excited about further space expeditions.

name: Orbital Space Settlements
description: Develop permanent near-orbit space habitation, providing a waystation and home base for further space activities.

0.speaker: The Spacer
0.text: I'm stoked I can spend 24/7 in space now!

7ec46a03-aa71-49c1-bece-0d645c536a19.speaker: The Accelerationist
7ec46a03-aa71-49c1-bece-0d645c536a19.text: ...we can finally start moving all our dirty industry off-planet...

92f32394-d8df-4835-be93-775ec8425eab.speaker: The Spacer
92f32394-d8df-4835-be93-775ec8425eab.text: This will also be our launch pad to go deeper into space.

name: Mostly Full Automation

image.attribution: Interior of Winston-Salem Chero-Cola Bottling Company, Winston-Salem, N.C. by unclibraries_commons, via openverse, public domain

description: Work on improving and proliferating automation systems to increase productivity.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: With automation comes more efficient use of materials, and better product quality.

0.speaker: The Economist
0.text: We are able to shorten the work week while still maintaining high rates of production.

name: Relocate Industry to Space
description: Mine resources to build infrastructure in space, harvesting fuel and beaming solar energy back to Earth.

0.speaker: The Economist
0.text: Many industries have successfully relocated the bulk of their operations into space, reducing planetside pollution and emissions.

0.speaker: The Economist
0.text: Many industries relocated to space, but are rife with corruption and exploitation, so few are willing to work there.

0.speaker: The Economist
0.text: Moving major industries into space proved to be way more complicated than anticipated, so most have remained planetside.

name: Biosphere 3
description: Closed-system ecologies will be necessary if we want to explore deeper into space. Or if the outside world becomes uninhabitable.

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: Our experiments were beset by disaster upon disaster.

4d6f39e6-72b0-48d3-986f-2a3cd3905513.speaker: The Ecologist
4d6f39e6-72b0-48d3-986f-2a3cd3905513.text: We weren't able to create a fully closed ecology...

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: We managed to create a self-sustaining environment--a necessary step for manned space exploration.

name: Vegetarian Mandate
description: Implement a ban on all meat products, effective immediately.

0.speaker: The Citizen
0.text: I struggled a bit with shifting to a vegetarian diet...

aa60d97b-a3a6-4d2c-8a59-7ad40bcd7129.speaker: The Citizen
aa60d97b-a3a6-4d2c-8a59-7ad40bcd7129.text: And I can still enjoy some milk and cheese, which has also made the transition easier.

ec834c9b-c080-4ffb-b9ce-4859ac79c072.speaker: The Citizen
ec834c9b-c080-4ffb-b9ce-4859ac79c072.text: but there's been such an explosion of creative vegetarian recipes and techniques that I haven't found myself missing meat.

name: Limits to Growth (For Some)
description: Prevent poorer regions of the world from developing further. While this will reduce the environmental costs of economic growth, it ignores the high and growing rates of consumption in the Global North.

0.speaker: The Fanonist
0.text: How cruel of you to forever condemn us to lives of poverty while others continue to live in absurd excess.

06129089-e348-4b43-b629-1cac46c7b3b6.speaker: The Fanonist
06129089-e348-4b43-b629-1cac46c7b3b6.text: It's not our poverty that threatens the world but their wasteful extravagance!

26aacd0c-fae2-4bf8-889a-ee636f80b7b8.speaker: The Malthusian
26aacd0c-fae2-4bf8-889a-ee636f80b7b8.text: There just isn't enough earth for everyone to live well.

d0bcf4c5-84c1-4547-96e2-0b4c283d80c6.speaker: The Fanonist
d0bcf4c5-84c1-4547-96e2-0b4c283d80c6.text: We only joined the revolution because we agreed to put that in the past!

name: Thorium Reactor
description: Develop scalable and safe thorium reactors.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: We can now deploy thorium reactors, which use a far more abundant fuel and create far less radioactive waste.

name: Antarctic Pumping
description: Pump water from the ocean onto Antarctica to reduce melting rates.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: The water has flowed back into the ocean — and at an accelerated rate.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: All of the pipelines, pump stations, and wind farms have caused significant ecological disruption.

name: Environmentalist Curriculum

image.attribution: R Chakarwarti, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons

description: Incorporate ecology curriculum so that ecological thinking becomes a foundation for all people.

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: The ecological education initiative is going great!

26fa3d45-9116-4226-b094-848f3d8e14f5.speaker: The Ecologist
26fa3d45-9116-4226-b094-848f3d8e14f5.text: People are learning about their local ecology and finding better ways of interacting and relating to the life around them.

name: Unconventional Petroleum Industry

image.attribution: Joshua Doubek, CC BY-SA 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons

description: With conventional oil sources running low, we can tap into other sources to keep the party going for a long time. Fracking, tar sands, and deep-water rigs are all possible sources, but they cause more environmental damage locally and globally in terms of increased CO2 emissions.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: This policy has opened up vast new reserves of oil for us to use.

99dbb89b-cff0-441d-828a-53dbc0ba16d3.speaker: The Engineer
99dbb89b-cff0-441d-828a-53dbc0ba16d3.text: It's dirtier, and riskier for wildlife...

d025af33-4f73-468c-8805-b21b0f75379d.speaker: The Engineer
d025af33-4f73-468c-8805-b21b0f75379d.text: but we have enough to last for awhile now.

name: Masculinity De-Tox

image.attribution: "Transformers movie Ironhide Autobot - 2007 GMC Topkick pickup truck at the Arclight theater in Hollywood" by Doug Kline is marked with CC BY-NC 2.0.

description: The pursuit of manliness leads many men to buy big trucks and eat lots of meat. This campaign will try to address both problems

0.speaker: The Consumerist
0.text: I'm not really happy about the SUV and truck ban...

0099d8e7-b5a4-4775-ba66-88695868ab71.speaker: The Consumerist
0099d8e7-b5a4-4775-ba66-88695868ab71.text: I worry that you have a tendency to go too far with your plans...

b8c89524-0f88-4213-9650-01bc69c3fad1.speaker: The Consumerist
b8c89524-0f88-4213-9650-01bc69c3fad1.text: I mean, couldn't I just get an electric version?

name: Electrify Road Vehicles

image.attribution: My electric Car! by TonyHall via Openverse, CC BY 2.0

description: Phase out combustion cars and mandate a transition to electric-motored vehicles.

0.speaker: The Economist
0.text: Electrifying automobiles significantly decreased transport emissions and did wonders for urban air pollution...

0b884a4a-b4da-4a7f-b56f-b7286336b42a.speaker: The Utopian
0b884a4a-b4da-4a7f-b56f-b7286336b42a.text: Maybe you should reconsider the dominance of cars in our public infrastructure?

1dcc5993-f8dc-4a82-b02a-4043fca2e968.speaker: The Economist
1dcc5993-f8dc-4a82-b02a-4043fca2e968.text: ...but at a high cost in electricity and lithium, without doing anything to improve transportation access or traffic deaths.

name: Ban Exotic Animal Trade
description:
Ban the breeding, capture, and sale of wildlife. This will help biodiversity and reduce the risk of new zoonoses. This policy is best done by simultaneously improving 
 living standards in the global South.

0.speaker: The Environmentalist
0.text: Finally! This moment couldn't come any sooner.

43b7daf2-c9af-44b9-bcaa-76107a5c9ba0.speaker: The Ecologist
43b7daf2-c9af-44b9-bcaa-76107a5c9ba0.text: The success of this initiative will depend on our ability to offer equitable alternative livelihoods for people who work in the wildlife trade.

6d216277-aff6-42a7-a53b-5be5ac55802c.speaker: The Bandung Bloc
6d216277-aff6-42a7-a53b-5be5ac55802c.text: How does one define 'exotic'? My family has bred bettas for many years. Now we are forced onto the black market.

name: Hempcrete

image.attribution: Attercop311 at English Wikipedia, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

description: Scale up concrete production from hemp, locking carbon in building materials.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: Hempcrete locked in a fair amount of carbon, but there are a few applications where it can't compete with conventional concrete.

5de55334-9776-4779-9c91-6edd153e6313.speaker: The Engineer
5de55334-9776-4779-9c91-6edd153e6313.text: We'll use it where we can, but it won't entirely replace old-fashioned concrete.

name: Malthusian Curriculum
description: Introduce a new curriculum that teaches children about how culture and evolution interact over human history, leading to genetically distinct ethnic groups. Children will also be taught Malthusian classics such as 'An Essay on Population', 'The Tragedy of the Commons', and 'The Population Bomb'. This curriculum will endear you to the Malthusian but antagonize the Fanonist.

0.speaker: The Malthusian
0.text: Unfortunate that more children are being created but at least we can teach them the way.

name: Energy Conservation Campaign

image.attribution: Department of Defense. American Forces Information Service. Defense Visual Information Center. 1994 (Public Domain)

description: Start a campaign to encourage energy conservation and low-energy lifestyles.

0.speaker: The Economist
0.text: It took some time...

3b296e00-470c-4716-a76f-5d76ffce00a6.speaker: The Economist
3b296e00-470c-4716-a76f-5d76ffce00a6.text: ...but people have come around to seeing that a low-energy lifestyle doesn't mean giving up a good quality of life.

name: Alternative Refrigerants
description: Gradual replacement of hydrofluorocarbons (HFCs) with alternative refrigerants like ammonia, carbon dioxide, propane, and isobutane that have a significantly lower global warming potential.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: We weren't able to find a refrigerant that checked off all the boxes...

a2775cb1-84c5-4d79-9f1a-99790306e9e6.speaker: The Engineer
a2775cb1-84c5-4d79-9f1a-99790306e9e6.text: Some had health and safety risks, some were less efficient, some had further environmental issues or were themselves potent greenhouse gases...

e6d10f63-467a-4438-a07c-c20ddc1da295.speaker: The Engineer
e6d10f63-467a-4438-a07c-c20ddc1da295.text: It's not the most efficient though.

e7b8df11-3618-4324-885a-80cf240c54a4.speaker: The Engineer
e7b8df11-3618-4324-885a-80cf240c54a4.text: Though funnily enough, we settled on R-744 (carbon dioxide) as a natural refrigerant.

name: Universal Family Planning
description: Seize the Means of Reproduction! Make abortions, contraceptives, and other family planning services universally accessible. This will decrease the rate of population growth and empower women.

0.speaker: The Citizen
0.text: What a relief that we finally have access to basic reproductive healthcare.

f802b781-ea55-419d-bde4-cf45e1125849.speaker: The Citizen
f802b781-ea55-419d-bde4-cf45e1125849.text: I can't believe it took a literal revolution for that to happen.

name: Flexitarian

image.attribution: cyclonebill from Copenhagen, Denmark, CC BY-SA 2.0

description: It is hard to make people give up meat entirely, but what if they are a bit less? Shrinking the livestock industry will help biodiversity and reduce GHG emissions—yet even more drastic measures may be needed. Even this moderate policy, however, will likely provoke opposition.

0.speaker: The Consumerist
0.text: This idea has gained popularity amongst my peers but it's a slippery slope.

name: Cap and Trade Program for Children

image.attribution: "Newborn Baby Boy" by rumpleteaser is licensed under CC

description: Limit the amount of children any family can have, and make these birth permits tradeable.

0.speaker: The Economist
0.text: I can't say that I feel *great* about tradeable birth permits...

01b0a6bd-9119-4ede-8fe3-3a19d38e4cf9.speaker: The Economist
01b0a6bd-9119-4ede-8fe3-3a19d38e4cf9.text: ...but this policy *is* successfully slowing population growth.

6fbfe4dc-3c6a-4990-97f9-8014c243d5cb.speaker: The Malthusian
6fbfe4dc-3c6a-4990-97f9-8014c243d5cb.text: It's worth it, if you ask me.

name: De-Extinction
description: Improved cloning techniques that would allow for the revival of extinct species.

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: Paul Ehrlich calls it a 'fascinating but dumb idea', but it has potential to return some species, like the Iberian Ibex.

0.speaker: Gossy
0.text: The religious scientific community is making great strides to recreate the exact species that would have been on Noah's ark.

name: Restore Desert Habitats

image.attribution: Sfivat, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

description: Turn vast swathes of arid land into a lush oasis to alter local weather patterns and change the direction of the winds, bringing more rain.

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: Deserts reflect more sunlight than bush, and the increased solar absorption has led to temperature increase.

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: Deserts reflect more sunlight than bush, and the increased solar absorption has led to temperature increase.

name: Ecosocialist Video Game
description: Develop a video game where citizens can devise their own plans regulating the global economy and natural world. People can debate, compare plans, and become involved in a lively socialist democracy.

0.speaker: The Citizen
0.text: This game is not only fun, but it taught me how socialism is the politics of seeing and thus trying to control the economy.

d65d2e06-c962-4f7a-8ee8-c7c9cf6ddfa3.speaker: The Citizen
d65d2e06-c962-4f7a-8ee8-c7c9cf6ddfa3.text: One day I want to become a planetary planner, just like you!

name: Compost
description: An old fashioned, low tech solution that could have massive carbon sequestration potential. Half of all waste is biodegradable, but instead of decomposing into a useful carbon-rich fertilizer, this waste produces methane emissions when it is dumped in the anaerobic landfills.

name: Ban Non-Indigenous Hunting

image.attribution: Ray Bird / Berkeley Hunt & Beaufort Hunt, Joint Meet, nr Kingscote, Gloucestershire 1988 / CC BY-SA 2.0

description: Hunting often reduces animal populations between 60-80 per cent. Seven per cent of all mammals are threatened with extinction because of hunting, 26 per cent of threatened mammals are endangered by hunting. Hunting is an important driver of the Sixth Extinction, but still secondary to land-use change caused by the livestock industry.

0.speaker: The Animal Liberationist
0.text: I can't believe people ever made a sport of killing things.

5151d4aa-a800-46df-9ff7-7afb61ff1dcc.speaker: The Animal Liberationist
5151d4aa-a800-46df-9ff7-7afb61ff1dcc.text: Glad we can finally get rid of that barbaric practice.

65181cc0-6e4b-4f25-a17c-b43bdfcecaa5.speaker: The Ecologist
65181cc0-6e4b-4f25-a17c-b43bdfcecaa5.text: Well, whether you agree with that or not, this is still a big improvement.

90b7294f-a480-49fd-a583-2cc1407ffa30.speaker: The Animal Liberationist
90b7294f-a480-49fd-a583-2cc1407ffa30.text: If you ask me, no one should be allowed to do it, no matter its cultural importance.

name: Floating Wind Turbines
description: Iron out some remaining technical issues for less complicated floating wind turbine installation and maintenance.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: We've worked out several of the technical issues that made floating wind turbines difficult.

8a781d50-2514-48db-beeb-aa90c61358c3.speaker: The Engineer
8a781d50-2514-48db-beeb-aa90c61358c3.text: They still require quite a bit of maintenance and repair, but it's good to have more options for energy production.

name: Improved Oceanic Shipping

image.attribution: A boat builder and boy customers, via openverse, Public Domain

description: Reducing speed of freighters by 10% increases fuel efficiency by a third. Improvements in ship design, cleaner fuels, and sails can reduce emissions further up to 55%.

0.speaker: The Environmentalist
0.text: The rapid circulation of goods dropped quite a bit after the revolution, but oceanic shipping is still a major activity.

72de4775-5dc8-4e38-a594-65434323faf9.speaker: The Environmentalist
72de4775-5dc8-4e38-a594-65434323faf9.text: I'm happy to see it's a bit better for the planet now!

name: Marine Protected Areas

image.attribution: Biodiversity Heritage Library, 'Brehms Tierleben', Public Domain

description: Significantly expand the area of no-take marine reserves.

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: More cetaceans and pinnipeds have been spotted!

name: Pedestrian and Bike-Friendly Cities

image.attribution: 'Oma Zylstra, biking along the canal' by jmv, under Attribution-ShareAlike 2.0 Generic

description: Close off more streets to cars, expand sidewalks, and add bike-share programs and well designed intersections with direct, level, well-lit, tree-lined bike lanes.

0.speaker: The Citizen
0.text: I love riding my bike, but I almost never did it because I was so afraid of being hit by a car.

658d69a2-d1a9-434d-a73c-bafa17a97783.speaker: The Citizen
658d69a2-d1a9-434d-a73c-bafa17a97783.text: But now that the bike paths have improved it's much safer and more pleasant.

8681cb70-5498-42d9-a43e-560bd3aed7c8.speaker: The Citizen
8681cb70-5498-42d9-a43e-560bd3aed7c8.text: And with how walkable cities have become, I don't even need to take my bike half the time.

name: Advances in Ecosystem Modelling

image.attribution: Chen Yu (known as Sinammonite on Deviantart) for Deng et al 2013, CC BY-SA 4.0

description: For the longest time, climate modelling was far more advanced than ecosystem modelling. This program will allow ecologists to catch up! Capture and predict dynamic, non-linear and emergent behavior within ecosystems, capable of fully functioning simulations of Earth’s biosphere.

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: It's amazing that we can now diagnose specialized issues like species decline in a matter of minutes instead of years.

39e2a992-fcac-45d6-9308-f33eb54d1976.speaker: The Ecologist
39e2a992-fcac-45d6-9308-f33eb54d1976.text: Well for example, our fish population had a sudden decline and we found that it was due to cooler temperatures attracting more predators in the area.

name: Accelerationist Curriculum

image.attribution: "Soviet poster 'dreams will come true'" by CozySpace | Ламповый Космос is marked with CC0 1.0.

description: Teach children and adolescents that they can move mountains, channel rivers, and reshape the Earth until it becomes a mere human artifact. Socialism should remove the fetters on the forces of production, accelerate scientific developments, and reach for the stars! Students will read Edward Bellamy, Aaron Bastani, and Mikhail Budyko.

0.speaker: The Accelerationist
0.text: Ah, Edward Bellamy, our founding father of speedy delivery and credit cards.

name: Search for Extraterrestrial Life

image.attribution: 1968 'Planet of the Apes' by x-ray delta one, via openverse, CC BY-NC-SA 2.0 license

description: Send radio waves into the dark void above. The hope that we're not alone.

0.speaker: The Spacer
0.text: Whoa, I just had a vision...

f1f2e273-82ad-49d3-aeb7-2ab45d5bcad7.speaker: The Spacer
f1f2e273-82ad-49d3-aeb7-2ab45d5bcad7.text: It was so detailed...was it a message from beyond the stars?

0.speaker: The Spacer
0.text: Waiting, waiting...

name: Cloud Seeding
description: Research a way to seed clouds to induce rain, helping to prevent crop failures.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: We weren't able to develop any consistent way of seeding clouds...

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: We managed to develop a decent method for cloud seeding.

246cc389-342e-4f9c-a857-47675fc31055.speaker: The Engineer
246cc389-342e-4f9c-a857-47675fc31055.text: This should help prevent drought-induced crop failures.

45e11fa3-bad3-4f7f-92cb-ce5c0f6833fa.speaker: The Farmer
45e11fa3-bad3-4f7f-92cb-ce5c0f6833fa.text: I can't say no to rain on-demand

e8c838cb-e6b3-4d77-b793-7ee887153e6f.speaker: The Engineer
e8c838cb-e6b3-4d77-b793-7ee887153e6f.text: It's not that we can make it rain on command, but we can nudge the probabilities in our favor.

name: Remediate Damaged Ecosystems
description: Restore, remediate, and/or reforest any land that has been degraded or otherwise affected by human activity, including peatlands, coastal ecosystems, forests, and more.

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: So many places are gradually becoming themselves again, after decades of exploitation and neglect.

831d85fa-1d59-472a-878f-96393df10059.speaker: The Ecologist
831d85fa-1d59-472a-878f-96393df10059.text: It's a beautiful sight to behold.

name: Low-Methane Cattle Fodder

image.attribution: "Cows, beach" by David Basanta is licensed under CC BY 2.0

description: The seaweed Asparagopsis taxiformis reduces methane emissions (i.e., burps) from cows by 80%. It will take some work to carry out further research and scale up production to feed billion cows.

0.speaker: The Consumerist
0.text: Maybe we should call burgers made from these cows "low methane burgers" what do you think?

852eb9b2-d8e6-4c97-a209-5073b4dc3981.speaker: The Consumerist
852eb9b2-d8e6-4c97-a209-5073b4dc3981.text: How should I know? I'm just a consumer.

0.speaker: The Farmer
0.text: While algae additives reduced enteric methane emissions from cattle farming, its effect was limited to the feedlot stage.

29f66ac6-e566-4829-9ebd-9e623fd7f75f.speaker: The Ecologist
29f66ac6-e566-4829-9ebd-9e623fd7f75f.text: The uptick in seaweed farms has also increased pressure on coastal ecosystems.

name: Long-Range Electric Aviation
description: Research ways to decarbonize long-range air travel.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: Development of hydrogen technology led to fuel cell adaptations allowing much lighter electric aircraft.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: Weight limitations of lithium batteries limited their ability to carry commercial aircraft long distances.

name: Desalination Plants
description: Expand desalination capacity to supplement dwindling freshwater supplies.

0.speaker: The Ecologist
0.text: Desalination brine is getting pumped back into the ocean...

169c8c71-287d-4da8-b173-ff1466638eb5.speaker: The Ecologist
169c8c71-287d-4da8-b173-ff1466638eb5.text: The super-saturated salt water decreases oxygen levels in the water, causing animals and plants to suffocate.

3452aed2-d252-437f-b034-2de2e5916367.speaker: The Ecologist
3452aed2-d252-437f-b034-2de2e5916367.text: Ocean species are not equipped to adjust to the immediate change in salinity caused by the release of brine into the area.

name: Bioenergy Carbon Capture and Sequestration (BECCS)
description: First you grow the plants, then you burn them for power and capture the emissions to store underground. It takes up a lot of land, but it's a way to get negative emissions and power generation.

0.speaker: The Engineer
0.text: I think we've worked out the last kinks that prevented us from scaling up BECCS.

2c76a3ce-c064-4163-9aaf-66d70e656603.speaker: The Farmer
2c76a3ce-c064-4163-9aaf-66d70e656603.text: Looks like I should start clearing some land, we're gonna need it for all those crops.

name: Perennial Cereals
description: Perennial versions of the major cereal crops mean they don't need to be replanted each year, disturbing the soil less and sequestering more in deep roots.

0.speaker: The Farmer
0.text: I love these new perennials...saves me a lot of work.

b39a5744-f603-473c-a651-bd944fff2e34.speaker: The Farmer
b39a5744-f603-473c-a651-bd944fff2e34.text: Don't need to worry about replanting them every year, or messing up my soil...

c400583e-1ff1-4de5-863e-da91bcceb309.speaker: The Farmer
c400583e-1ff1-4de5-863e-da91bcceb309.text: Any change where I have to work less is a welcome one.
